FuncDef:
The vlan-mapping modulo command configures VLAN-to-instance mapping based on a default algorithm.
The undo vlan-mapping modulo command restores the default mapping. The vlan-mapping modulo command configures VLAN-to-instance mapping based on a default algorithm. The undo vlan-mapping modulo command restores the default mapping. By default, all VLANs are mapped to Common and Internal Spanning Tree (CIST), namely, instance 0.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a module value.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 63.

ExtraInfo: Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol (MSTP) divides a switching network into multiple regions, each of which has independent Multiple Spanning Trees. Each spanning tree is called a Multiple Spanning Tree instance (MSTI), and each region is called a Multiple Spanning Tree (MST) region.
